title: Gen Z is the most pro union generation alive. Will they organize to reflect that?
description: A recent poll shows that public support for labor organizing is the highest it's been in decades. But union membership is at an all-time low. Will Gen Z bridge that gap?

title: DA Bragg sues Jim Jordan claiming 'an unconstitutional attempt to undermine' the case
description: The New York prosecutor who is pursuing criminal charges against former President Trump says a GOP-led congressional panel is trying to interfere with with his case. Now he's taking them to court.

title: The AR-15 rifle used in the Louisville shooting was bought legally
description: Authorities said the 25-year-old gunman purchased the weapon from a Louisville dealer on April 4, six days before the attack.

title: Democrats will flock to Chicago for the party's 2024 convention
description: This will be the 13th time in the DNC's history that Chicago will host a convention. Democrats nodded toward the "Blue Wall" of Midwestern states they need to win in 2024.

title: Brittney Griner is working on a memoir about her captivity in Russia
description: Saying she is ready to share the "unfathomable" experience of being arrested and incarcerated in Russia, basketball star Brittney Griner is working on a memoir that is scheduled for spring 2024.

title: 2 youths were killed in the latest fire blamed on an e-bike in New York City
description: It's the fifth fire-related death this year in New York City where officials have said an e-bike was the cause. A father and his five children were in the second-story apartment when the fire began.

title: Nickolas Wilt was shot in the head on his fourth shift as a Louisville police officer
description: Nickolas Wilt, a 26-year-old rookie officer, ran towards a gunman who opened fire at a Louisville bank on Monday. He's the latest to be heralded as a hero amid America's gun violence crisis.

title: PHOTOS: See the wildflower 'superbloom' happening across California
description: Thanks to a very wet year, the Golden State is experiencing a rare "superbloom" that's blanketing the ground with a variety of richly colored plants.

title: Police came to pull a Jeep out of a lake. They found a woman inside, alive
description: It wasn't until after a tow truck came that anyone realized someone was in the vehicle, some 40 feet from shore in a Texas lake.

title: A rise in attacks on schools has left Brazil reeling — and searching for solutions
description: The numbers are far less than in the U.S. but school attacks are definitely on the increase, prompting national debate and soul-searching — and a debate over strategies to prevent future tragedies.

title: A judge rules that Elizabeth Holmes cannot remain free during appeal
description: Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes was convicted of wire fraud and conspiracy to commit wire fraud last year and sentenced to 11 years in prison.

title: How an abortion pill ruling could threaten the FDA's regulatory authority
description: A medical ethics expert says a Texas abortion pill ruling is unprecedented because a federal judge "standing in" for  regulators could have far-reaching implications beyond mifepristone.

title: Medical ethics expert discusses the FDA's authority following abortion drug rulings
description: Two rulings on the abortion drug mifepristone raise questions about the FDA's authority. NPR's Michel Martin talks with medical ethics expert Holly Fernandez Lynch of the University of Pennsylvania.

title: One camp at a time, a Seattle group is transforming its approach to homelessness
description: During the pandemic, a nonprofit in Seattle took a different approach to solving homelessness: helping whole encampments of unhoused people themselves make a plan to get housing.

title: He says U.S. troops abused him in Iraq's Abu Ghraib and his life is still ruined
description: This Iraqi man says that 20 years after appearing in a notorious photo in U.S. detention in Abu Ghraib prison, his family lives in shame and poverty, never receiving U.S. compensation or apologies.

title: In Ireland, Biden is on a diplomatic and deeply personal mission
description: President Biden's trip marking the 25th anniversary of the Good Friday Agreement is part diplomacy and part homecoming.

title: More than half of Americans have dealt with gun violence in their personal lives
description: A national poll finds that a majority of Americans have felt the effects of gun violence in their personal lives.

title: Texas residents wait and watch as a sinkhole in their town grows
description: A huge sinkhole that seemed stable for 15 years suddenly began expanding about a week ago, growing by several acres and leaving nearby residents terrified that it will take them and their homes.

title: A smart move on tax day: Sign up for health insurance using your state's tax forms
description: Paying taxes can be agonizing. So can shopping for health insurance. But a handful of states have made enrolling in subsidized or free coverage a little easier for people when they file their taxes

title: Biden ends COVID national emergency after Congress acts
description: The U.S. national emergency to respond to the COVID-19 pandemic ended Monday as President Joe Biden signed a bipartisan congressional resolution to bring it to a close after three years.

title: The mom of the 6-year-old who shot his teacher is being charged with child neglect
description: The child has not been charged in the shooting of Abby Zwerner, 25, a teacher at Richneck Elementary School in Newport News, Virginia.

title: Hundreds flee from wildfire in South Korean seaside city
description: Hundreds of South Koreans were forced to flee a wildfire fueled by strong winds that burned parts of an eastern coastal city Tuesday, destroying dozens of homes.
